meanings.definition: A natural luminous body visible in the sky, especially at night.
meanings.sent1: Look at the bright star in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The stars twinkled in the dark night.
meanings.sent3: The little girl wished upon a star for a puppy.
meanings.sent4: She was the star of the astronomy club, shining brighter than any other member.
meanings.sent5: The star's light guided the lost travelers through the night.

meanings.definition: A famous or exceptionally talented performer in the entertainment industry.
meanings.sent1: The singer became a star after her hit song.
meanings.sent2: Many people dream of becoming a movie star.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he was a star even in his own kitchen.
meanings.sent4: She shone like a star on the stage, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The young actress quickly rose to stardom and became a household name.

meanings.definition: To perform outstandingly in a particular field or activity.
meanings.sent1: She will star in the school play next week.
meanings.sent2: The athlete hopes to star in the upcoming competition.
meanings.sent3: The chef will star in a cooking show on TV.
meanings.sent4: He always manages to star in every project he undertakes.
meanings.sent5: The student will star in the science fair with her innovative project.
